isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ASSEMBLE - RANGE CYLINDER

step1.para: To prevent rusting, lightly lubricate the cylinder bores and piston bar with a light oil. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Place the range cylinder piston on the piston bar with the rubber-coated side facing the shoulder on the bar. The piston is properly installed when the snap ring groove is exposed.
Install the snap ring on the piston bar, using care to avoid overstretching the snap ring.

note.para: If the snap ring fits loosely in its groove, it is overstretched and must be replaced.

step1.para: Apply silicone lubricant supplied with O-ring kit to the range piston lip surface and to the four (4) O-rings.
Install the proper O-ring in the groove in the range cylinder.
Install the range piston assembly in the range cylinder.
Install the proper O-ring in the groove on the inside of the range cylinder cover, and install the largest O-ring in the groove on the outside of the range cylinder cover ( Figure 103).
Place the smallest O-ring in the recess in the cover, and install the cover ( Figure 103).
Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the retaining bolts, and install the two (2) bolts on the range cover. Tighten the bolts to 27 to 31 Nm (20 to 23 ft-lbs).
